channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: This 830-horsepower, crab-walking SUV will be the second Hummer EV
item.description: More agile than the Hummer EV truck but with a slightly smaller battery pack.

item.title: ABL Space has never launched a rocket, but it just landed a huge contract
item.description: “We take the scaling challenge seriously and have a clear roadmap.”

item.title: 8Bitdo Pro 2 gamepad review: A $50 bargain for cool features, killer performance
item.description: Backside buttons, customizations make an already solid $50 gamepad even better.

item.title: Four astronauts took a Dragon for a spin on Monday morning
item.description: Cargo and Crew Dragons are creating a bit of a traffic jam in space.

item.title: Review: Sean Bean gives Snowpiercer a charismatic villain to stir the pot
item.description: With fictional world established, S2 is free to explore its complicated human dynamics.

item.title: What we’re expecting from Google’s custom “Whitechapel” SoC in the Pixel 6
item.description: Google wants to dump Qualcomm, probably to give longer OS support?

item.title: Narwhal tusks tell a troubling tale
item.description: Narwhal diets are changing as the Arctic warms.

item.title: It’s the Tune Squad vs. the Goon Squad in Space Jam: A New Legacy trailer
item.description: LeBron James leads Looney Tunes characters in basketball rematch for the digital age.

item.title: Xbox Game Streaming app is now live on Windows—via a sneaky download
item.description: Until we see planned web browser version, this loophole will have to suffice.

item.title: Amazon admits its drivers sometimes have to pee in bottles
item.description: “Drivers can and do have trouble finding restrooms,” Amazon admits.

item.title: Malicious cheats for Call of Duty: Warzone are circulating online
item.description: The cheat is fake, but the malware it installs is the real thing.

item.title: Waymo CEO John Krafcik steps down
item.description: Waymo ordered “up to” 82,000 vehicles in 2018. Today, it has “well over 600.”

item.title: The forgotten director who gave us The Force, inspired 2001, and changed film
item.description: You may not know this Canadian documentarian, but Stanley Kubrick and George Lucas sure did.

item.title: US sanctions are squeezing Huawei, but for how long?
item.description: Huawei’s growth slowed in 2020, as it had trouble securing the state-of-the-art chips.

item.title: Real-world data shows vaccines kicking butt—including against scary variant
item.description: “Very, very good reason for everyone to get vaccinated,” Fauci says.

item.title: Feds say hackers are likely exploiting critical Fortinet VPN vulnerabilities
item.description: Exploits allow hackers to log into VPNs and then access other network resources.

item.title: New wave of App Store rejections suggests iOS 14.5, new iPad may be imminent
item.description: Rejections affect apps with SDK that uses device fingerprinting to track users.

item.title: Loot boxes too similar to “problem gambling” to avoid regulation, report says
item.description: Determinations: Loot box “value” matters; wealth doesn’t drive who becomes a “whale.”

item.title: TSMC bumps spending up 50% to meet increased demand
item.description: Expansion is a no-brainer when your fabs are at 100% and still can’t meet demand.

item.title: Sealed Super Mario Bros. shatters record with $660,000 auction sale
item.description: Vintage 1986 box sat unnoticed in a desk drawer for 35 years.

item.title: Egalitarians are more aware of inequality
item.description: Some of our disagreements about inequality come from people’s failure to notice it.

item.title: ISP imposes data cap, explains it to users with condescending pizza analogy
item.description: WOW tells users that exceeding data cap is like taking “extra slice” of pizza.

item.title: Nuclear should be considered part of clean energy standard, White House says
item.description: Biden’s plan goes beyond most states’ definitions of clean power.

item.title: New Play Store rules block most apps from scanning your entire app list
item.description: Your app list can contain sensitive data, so Google is locking down access.

item.title: Fender bender in Arizona illustrates Waymo’s commercialization challenge
item.description: Self-driving systems won’t necessarily make the same mistakes as human drivers.

item.title: The Emoji Story: You should never have this much fun learning about Unicode
item.description: “800M people could use a period emoji right now. How many people are talking about broccoli?”

item.title: After years on PlayStation, MLB The Show hits Xbox Game Pass at launch
item.description: Former PlayStation exclusive is a major coup for Microsoft’s subscription service.

item.title: Rocket Report: SpaceX readies Super Heavy, Russia tests new engine
item.description: “We chose the name Dauntless because we believe it embodies the spirit of the company.”

item.title: Not an April Fool’s joke: Theatrical trailer for The Suicide Squad drops
item.description: “The only joke here is on the supervillains who agreed to work for Amanda Waller.”

item.title: The secret to a rat’s sense of touch? It’s all in how the whiskers bend
item.description: Scientists develop first mechanical simulation of whisker/follicle interactions.

item.title: Xinuos—owners of what used to be SCO—file suit against Red Hat and IBM
item.description: Suit alleges stolen intellectual property in IBM AIX, and collusion with RHEL.

item.title: Microsoft’s Cortana meets an untimely end on iOS and Android
item.description: This is only the latest development in a series of cuts for Cortana.

item.title: Supreme Court’s pro-Facebook ruling could unleash “flood” of robocalls
item.description: Robocall systems aren’t “autodialers” if they don’t generate random numbers.

item.title: Feds say man broke into public water system and shut down safety processes
item.description: Indictment underscores the potential for remote intrusions to have fatal consequences.

item.title: E3 2021 leak suggests paywall, Nvidia streaming; ESA says it’ll be “free for all”
item.description: Leaked ESA pitch includes name change: “Electronic Entertainment Experience.”

item.title: Nintendo’s latest Mario game for the Switch is $10 off today
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on Amazon devices, MagSafe chargers, and more.

item.title: Cable lobby says it hates Biden plan to expand broadband and lower prices
item.description: Industry says US should favor private ISPs and take no action to lower prices.

item.title: Prior to the Chicxulub impact, rainforests looked very different
item.description: Plant fossils from Colombia show a turnover from conifers to today’s forests.

item.title: Atari’s corporate zombie raises $110,000 overnight from Centipede NFTs
item.description: And that’s just the company’s first wave of crypto-signed digital “collectibles.”

item.title: This Swedish carbon-fiber battery could revolutionize car design
item.description: Battery combines carbon-fiber anode and lithium-iron phosphate-coated foil cathode.

item.title: FDA slams “Real Water” linked to liver failure; water plant manager MIA
item.description: A lawyer for the water company said it can’t find its plant manager or lead technician.

item.title: Arizona lawmaker: Big Tech “hired almost every lobbyist” to kill app store bill
item.description: “There just wasn’t enough support” after lobbying blitz, one legislator said.

item.title: LineageOS 18.1 brings Android 11 to over 60 smartphones
item.description: The FOSS, all-volunteer Android distribution lands on the latest version.

item.title: Activision targets Call of Duty: Warzone leaks with DMCA takedowns
item.description: Continuing a trend of using DMCA for leaked game footage.

item.title: 105,000 years ago in the Kalahari Desert, people invented complex culture
item.description: A recently published study suggests coastal people didn’t have a monopoly on innovation.

item.title: Amazon colluded with publishers to fix book prices, class-action suit alleges
item.description: Retailers complain that contract terms cement Amazon’s dominant position.

item.title: Two steps forward: Virgin Galactic’s new ship and Dragon’s diverse crew
item.description: “You have to start somewhere.”

item.title: North Korean hackers return, target infosec researchers in new operation
item.description: Google outs the new op two months after shutting down a previous campaign.

item.title: Physicists give antimatter the chills
item.description: If anything’s odd about antimatter, we need to slow it down enough to see it.

item.title: Factory mix-up spoils 15 million doses of J&J COVID vaccine
item.description: The error at a manufacturing facility will delay future shipments of the vaccine.

item.title: Trial started for vaccine against one of the scariest coronavirus variants
item.description: The vaccine is being developed “out of an abundance of caution,” Fauci says.

item.title: HoloLens for 120,000 Army personnel: Microsoft inks $21.9 billion deal
item.description: Was originally pegged at $480 million in 2018, follows scrutiny over other DOD deals.

item.title: Apple commits to build “grid-scale” energy storage in California
item.description: 110 of Apple’s manufacturing partners are moving to 100 percent renewable energy.

item.title: Ubiquiti breach puts countless cloud-based devices at risk of takeover
item.description: Report: Theft of crypto secrets could allow hackers to remotely log in to devices.
